title: American_Top_40_1974_October_12th
description:
"You're hearing the hottest hits in the USA as the countdown goes on and doesn't stop until we get to number one."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

Casey tells us whatever happened to a group called The Cowsills.

The 1969 number one song of the year was sung by a man who was part of a group which never existed. That man is in the countdown with another former number one hit. Casey explains.

There is a song in the countdown by Dr. Winston O'Boogie. He also goes by the name Reverend Kaptain Kundalini and Thumbs Ghurkin.

A man whose real name is Steven Demetre Georgiou also has a song in the top ten, and Alice Bowie "appears" on a "song" in the top ten.

There is a woman in the countdown who was nominated for country single of the year, country album of the year, country female vocalist of the year, and country entertainer of the year even though she swears she's not country.

A listener wants to know, "What were the top 10 songs of the 1940s?" Casey lists the ten most popular, and then one more that was so special that we still hear it today.

40:    Honey Honey - ABBA
39:    Papa Don't Take No Mess Part 1 - James Brown
38:    Everlasting Love - Carl Carlton        
37:    Higher Place - Kool & The Gang     
36:    Overnight Sensation (Hit Record) - The Raspberries     
35:    Devotion - Earth, Wind & Fire    
34:    The Need To Be - Jim Weatherly

32:    Rock Me Gently - Andy Kim
31:    Kings Of The Party - Brownsville Station
30:    Do It ('Til You're Satisfied) - B.T. Express
29:    Straight Shootin' Woman - Steppenwolf    
28:    Carefree Highway - Gordon Lightfoot
27:    Fallin' In Love - Souther, Hillman, Furay Band
26:    Give It To The People - The Righteous Brothers

24:    Whatever Gets You Through The Night - John Lennon
23:    Back Home Again - John Denver
22:    You Ain't Seen Nothing Yet - Bachman-Turner Overdrive

20:    Tin Man - America
19:    Sweet Home Alabama - Lynyrd Skynyrd

17:    Love Me For A Reason - The Osmonds
16:    Do It Baby - The Miracles
15:    Jazzman - Carole King
14:    You Little Trustmaker - The Tymes
